reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Cove for a weekend wine tasting trip in September 2008 and had a fantastic time. The hotel is well situated for the Westbank wineries (Mission Hill, Quails Gate, Mt. Boucherie) and has a great lake-front location.
reviews.title: Great weekend getaway!

likes.liked: — Spacious clean rooms with kitchens, fire pits
likes.disliked: — Located far from some of the best vineyards

reviews.text: The suites are very big and have everything you could need. We had a two bedroom, two bathroom room that would easily have worked for two couples and was way more that we needed just for the two of us. Our suite was on the ground floor and so had a lovely and huge deck that opened up to the pool area and a short walk down to the lake. We were there in the fall and so didn't use the pool, but really enjoyed the gas fire pits which are situated around the property down by the water. Sitting around them while enjoying a nice glass of wine was the perfect end to the day.
reviews.title: Great Resort - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant food was good but not outstanding. We didn't use the spa as it was fully booked during our stay.
reviews.title: Great property!!!

likes.liked: — Units were spacious and very well appointed

reviews.text: The only downside to this hotel is that Westbank is about a 45 mintue drive from the Naramata bench and even farther down to the Golden Mile, where many of the vineyards are located.
reviews.title: Unbelievable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely reccommend this hotel for anyone intersted in staying near Kelowna in a beautiful location on the lake. However, if you're looking to visit the vineyards further south then check out the hotel at Burrowing Owl or the Naramata Heritage Inn.
reviews.title: Beautiful Condo resort

likes.disliked: — a little out of the way from downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this resort a few times for work related events, and was always impressed by the room and the views, so I decided to stay here for a long weekend.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort! Great views! Kinda snotty staff.

reviews.text: The rooms are very nicely appointed, the kitchens have many of the basics, and the beds are super comfy! Most sides of the hotel have great views.
reviews.title: high expectations shattered

reviews.text: One thing that came up a few times by other reviewers was a particularly snotty front desk clerk, and the second we walked up to her desk we knew EXACTLY who we were dealing with. I know how stupid a rude to hotel staff people can be when they are on vacation, but I seriously do not know what the world has done to this woman to make her every response so condescending and rude, but I would strongly recommend that the manager of this resort either can this woman or put a gag on her.
reviews.title: Wonderful views and suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always like to look at reviews of hotels I have stayed at in the past and future to see what other travelers are saying, and I know well enough to take these reviews with a grain of salt. But when the same things comes up over and over again, you need to pay attention.
reviews.title: Excellent all-round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again, and recommend it to my friends, but I would give a heads up about the front desk staff.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at the Cove

reviews.text: Five nights at the Cove with 2 families - one with small children and other with teenagers. Amentities all very good especially for the small ones. Extra costs for boating was expensive but service was very good. Spa service was well priced and very good service - they brought in a specialist at a different time. All around a great vacation. Could possibly use a larger gym.
reviews.title: Great for Families

reviews.text: We travelled there for a girl's getaway and the power turned off due to some unforseen circumstance, not on the fault of the hotel. However, the procedures and practices they had in place during this all day power failure was not professional. The poor folks at the front desk had to answer all sorts of questions they did not have answers to. No Front Desk Manager, no General Manager, no note under the door (because the phones did not work) was to be found on the premise of this resort.
reviews.title: Great product, terrible operations.

reviews.text: The least that could have been done during this time is to let the guests know that we would not have hot water (ALL DAY), and the back up generator was not very reliable. The hallways and stairwells were dark, dangerously dark. Our food was spoiled and we had to order out for all three meals when we had food to prepare. This costed us a couple hundred extra dollars to feed the months of more than 6 people.
reviews.title: Modern, fresh.....
Mediocre hotel. Snotty desk agent hasn't improved!
reviews.text: Needless to say, having been in the hotel industry myself, I felt sorry for the front line staff that had to deal with the complaints all day, when some guidance from Managers could have helped. Would probably not stay there again due to the operations conducted during this time.

We stayed at the Cove for 4 nights as a getaway from the city and hussle and bussle. Our 2 bedroom suite was fantastic in every way with all amenities you need on holiday. The pool area and hot tub were a great hit with my young son unfortunately the weather did not play along! The hotel staff were good. We ate at the restaurant once and it was pleasant with good staff and food - decor is also modern and fresh.
reviews.title: I wanted to stay longer

reviews.text: If you are looking for a 5 Star hotel with terrible management and staff and no service this is the Hotel for you at over 600.00 per night. Compound this with management that are all talk and no action it was a frustrating weekend. Luckily for us we did not spend much time in the Room. We start our vacation Day 1
reviews.title: Change The Management

reviews.text: We arrived and had to take our own bags to the room, for we were directed to take one of their bellman's cart and unload our car ourselves. When entering the room we noticed huge stains on the carpet and the floors were filthy. We called housekeeping and the front desk and told us they had problems with the carpet that stains were soiling through after cleaning. there was no more rooms so we were stuck. They then called a young girl with no experience to clean the floor. Believe it or not a damp mop no soap.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel with great views

reviews.text: We got over our first days experience and focused on the landscape which was very beautiful. The second night out of 6 we could not even get reservations in the hotel restaurant because they booked a huge group. So you cant even eat in your own hotel. I called then the manager but she defered me the the resturant manager that got me in. I went down and half the resturant was empty and remained empty for the next 2 hours. I did not even want to question that one. The next night they got us in to Dine and even booked the best seat in the house overlooing the outside lake and mountains. When we arrived a young girl said that the table was ready and walked us over to find that someone else seated another couple in our spot. We were given a choice to eat a hour later 9pm or right in front of the kitchen where the AC could not get the temperature below 75 degrees.
reviews.title: mixed feelings!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After free drinks, the coves way of saying sorry all time for mistakes we ate and left if was pretty good but not 5 star for sure.
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Day 4, the kitchen in the codo is still not cleaned and the floor not touched. At this point I called and left a message for the housekeeping manager with no call back.
reviews.title: Mixed Feeling about The Cove
